DOCNAME: CASE "RELATING TO CERTAIN ASPECTS OF THE LAWS ON THE USE OF LANGUAGES IN EDUCATION IN BELGIUM" v. BELGIUM (MERITS)
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 14+P1-2;No violation of Art. 8;Just satisfaction reserved
TEXT: CARDINAL . The object of the ORG 's request is to submit the case to the ORG , so that the ORG may decide whether or not certain provisions of the NORP linguistic legislation relating to education are in conformity with the requirements of ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL ( article CARDINAL , article DATE ) of the Convention and Article CARDINAL of the Protocol of DATE ( hereinafter referred to as " LAW " ) ( PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . The Applicants , who are parents of families of NORP nationality , applied to the ORG both on their own behalf and on behalf of their children DATE , of whom there are CARDINAL . Pointing out that they are LANGUAGE - speaking or that they express themselves most frequently in LANGUAGE , they want their children to be educated in that language .

GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE , PERSON and PERSON , where the signatories of CARDINAL of the CARDINAL applications ( Nos . GPE , GPE , DATE and CARDINAL ) live , belong to the region considered by law as NORP - speaking , whereas ORG ) has since DATE formed part of a separate administrative district with a " special status " . In all of these districts ( " communes " ) , part of the population - in some cases a large part - is LANGUAGE - speaking .
CARDINAL . Though the CARDINAL applications differ on a number of points , they are similar in many respects . For the time being it is sufficient to note that in substance they complain that ORG :
- does not provide any LANGUAGE education in the municipalities where the Applicants live or , in the case of PERSON , that the provision made for such education is , in their opinion , inadequate ;
- withholds grants from any institutions in the said municipalities which may fail to comply with the linguistic provisions of the legislation for schools ;
- refuses to homologate leaving certificates issued by such institutions ;
- does not allow the Applicants ' children to attend the NORP classes which exist in certain places ;

- thereby obliges the Applicants either to enrol their children in local schools , a solution which they consider contrary to their aspirations , or to send them to school in the " LOC district " , where the language of instruction is NORP or NORP according to the child 's mother - tongue or usual language or in the " LANGUAGE - speaking region " ( PERSON area ) . Such " scholastic emigration " is said to entail serious risks and hardships .

CARDINAL . The Applications in so far as they have been declared admissible by the ORG , allege that ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL ( article CARDINAL , article DATE ) of the Convention and Article CARDINAL of the LAW ( PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) have been violated . The violation is said to be a result of the Applicants and their children being subjected to various provisions of LAW of DATE " on language regulations in primary and intermediate education " , LAW of DATE " on the conferring of academic degrees " , the Acts of DATE and DATE , LAW of DATE " relating to the use of languages in education " and the Act of CARDINALnd DATE " on the use of languages in administrative matters " , etc . The Acts of CARDINALth and DATE were repealed by LAW DATE , but were still in force when the PERSON , GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE Applicants brought their cases before the Commission , and those Applicants still challenge these Acts while at the same time attacking the present legislation .

CARDINAL . Summarising the opinion expressed in its Report of CARDINALth DATE ( hereinafter referred to as " the ORG " ) , the ORG recalled in paragraph CARDINAL of its memorial of DATE that it took the view :
" - by CARDINAL votes to CARDINAL , that the legislation complained of was not incompatible with the first sentence of LAW ( PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) , considered in isolation ;

- unanimously , that the legislation was not incompatible with the second sentence of the said LAW ( PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) , considered in isolation or in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the Convention ;

- by CARDINAL votes to QUANTITY , that the legislation was not incompatible , in the case of the Applicants , with LAW article CARDINAL) of the LAW , considered in isolation or in conjunction with LAW article DATE ) ;

- by CARDINAL votes to CARDINAL , that the general system of education in the areas which are unilingual by law was not incompatible with the first sentence of LAW , considered in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the Convention ;

- by CARDINAL votes to CARDINAL , that the same was true of the " special status " conferred by LAW of CARDINALnd DATE on CARDINAL bilingual communes , of which PERSON is one , on the periphery of GPE ;

- by CARDINAL votes to CARDINAL , that the Acts of DATE were incompatible with the first sentence of LAW , read in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the LAW , in so far as they result in the total withdrawal of subsidies from provincial , commune and private schools providing , in the form of non - subsidised classes and in addition to instruction given in the language prescribed by the language legislation , complete or partial education in another language ; - unanimously , that the conditions on which children whose parents live outside the LOC district may be enrolled in schools in that district ( LAW of DATE ) were not , in the case of the Applicants , incompatible with the first sentence of LAW , read in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the Convention ;

- that the Acts of DATE were incompatible with the first sentence of LAW , read in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the LAW , in so far as they prevent certain children , solely on the basis of their parents ' place of residence , from attending LANGUAGE - language schools at Louvain ( CARDINAL votes to CARDINAL ) and in the above - mentioned CARDINAL communes on the periphery of GPE ( CARDINAL votes to CARDINAL ) ;

- by CARDINAL votes to CARDINAL , that the legislation complained of was also incompatible with the first sentence of LAW , read in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the LAW , in so far as it has resulted , since DATE , in a refusal to homologate certificates relating to secondary schooling not in accordance with the language requirements . "
CARDINAL . In the course of the written proceedings the following submissions were made on the merits of the case :
- by ORG in its memorial of CARDINALth DATE :
" ORG submits the following conclusions :

( CARDINAL ) The NORP legislation attacked in the Applications is incompatible neither with LAW ( PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) nor with LAW article CARDINAL) of the LAW if those provisions are considered in isolation .
( CARDINAL ) Nor is it contrary to the first and second sentence of LAW or LAW even if read in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL , article DATE ) of the Convention .

( CARDINAL ) Neither the DATE Acts nor those of DATE are incompatible with LAW , first sentence , of the LAW , read in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the LAW , in so far as they forbid the establishment or subsidising by the ORG of any schools which do not comply with the language legislation .

( CARDINAL ) The DATE Acts are not contrary to LAW , first sentence , of the LAW , read in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the LAW , in so far as they result in the total withdrawal of subsidies from schools that , while they have sections in which tuition is given in the regional language , also provide complete or partial education in another language .

( CARDINAL ) The system introduced by LAW DATE in the communes on the periphery of GPE , including PERSON , is not incompatible with LAW , first sentence , of the LAW , read in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the Convention .

( CARDINAL ) The residence conditions laid down in the DATE Acts for admission to the LANGUAGE - language schools at PERSON and in the communes on the periphery of GPE , including PERSON , are compatible with LAW , first sentence , of the LAW , read in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the Convention .

( CARDINAL ) The provisions of DATE Acts are compatible with LAW , first sentence , of the LAW , read in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the LAW , in so far as they result in the refusal of homologation of secondary school leaving certificates for the sole reason that the schooling covered by them has not been in accordance with the requirements of the language legislation .
The Belgian Government reserves the right to add to or modify these conclusions in the course of the proceedings " .
- by the Commission in its memorial of DATE and , in almost identical terms , in that of DATE , prior to the judgment of CARDINALth DATE :

" As it recalled in its memorial of DATE , the ORG acts in the general interest and not , strictly speaking , as plaintiff vis - à - vis the High Contracting Party against which the Applications submitted to it for appraisal are directed .
It therefore once more formulates its conclusions interrogatively and invites the ORG to decide whether or not the legislation of which the Applicants complain satisfies the requirements of :
( a ) the first sentence of LAW ( PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) , considered in isolation ;
( b ) the second sentence of that Article ( PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) , considered in isolation ;
( c ) LAW article CARDINAL) of the LAW , considered in isolation ;
( d ) the first sentence of LAW read in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the Convention ;
( e ) the second sentence of LAW , read in conjunction with LAW article CARDINAL+PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the Convention ;
( f ) LAW , read in conjunction with LAW article DATE ) .
In particular the ORG requests the ORG to decide whether or not , in the case of the Applicants , there is violation of all or some of the above - mentioned articles , inter alia :
( a ) in so far as the Acts of DATE prevented , and those of DATE prevent :
- the establishment , or
- the subsidisation
by the ORG , of schools not in conformity with the general linguistic requirements ;

( b ) in so far as the Acts of DATE result in the complete withdrawal of subsidies from provincial , commune or private schools providing , in the form of non - subsidised classes and in addition to the instruction given in the language prescribed by the linguistic Acts , full or partial instruction in another language ;
( c ) with regard to the special status conferred by LAW , third paragraph , of the Act of CARDINALnd DATE on CARDINAL communes , of which PERSON is one , on the periphery of GPE ;
( d ) with regard to the conditions on which children whose parents reside outside LOC may be enrolled in the schools of that district ( LAW of DATE ) ;

( e ) in so far as LAW , last paragraph , of LAW of DATE and LAW , third paragraph , of the Act of CARDINALnd DATE prevent certain children , solely on the basis of their parents ' place of residence , from attending LANGUAGE - language schools at PERSON and in the CARDINAL communes mentioned under ( c ) above ;

( f ) in so far as the Acts of DATE resulted , and those of DATE result , in absolute refusal to homologate certificates relating to secondary schooling not in conformity with the language requirements in education .

For the reasons stated at the end of its report ( ... ) , the ORG still refrains for the time being from putting forward conclusions on the claims for damages submitted by the Applicants of PERSON and PERSON , PERSON and PERSON . "
- by ORG in its memorial of DATE :
" Subsidiary , in case the ORG should feel obliged to adopt the ORG 's viewpoint , the NORP State points out the legitimate grounds that justify the legislation attacked .
ORG maintains however as its main argument the conclusions set down in its first memorial on the merits and reserves its final conclusions .
The ORG wishes to point out :

- first of all , that the distinctions of which the Applicants complain do not affect the rights laid down in LAW article CARDINAL) of the LAW , since the rights of parents and children with regard to education are defined not in that LAW but in LAW ( PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) ;

- that these distinctions do not affect the negative right and the freedom laid down in LAW ( PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) but relate to positive benefits and favours , which the ORG may , of course , grant in order to facilitate the exercise of that right and freedom but concerning which the High Contracting Parties have expressly declared that they did not intend to enter into any obligation ;

- that the distinctions in question do not interfere with any desire of the Applicants simply to have their children educated but concern their wish to have them educated in accordance with their linguistic preferences , and that any such preferences held in educational matters were deliberately not included by the High Contracting Parties in the enumeration of rights and freedoms safeguarded by the ORG ;
- that the rule of non - discrimination in LAW ) of the LAW can not apply to the distinctions of which the Applicants complain , since it relates only to rights and freedoms laid down in the LAW ;
- that the Applicants ' complaints are unfounded . "
